title: Teen surfer killed in shark attack Â· 2023 was hottest in 125,000 years â€” your morning briefing
text:
Teen surfer killed in shark attack · 2023 was hottest in 125,000 years — your morning briefing
Share article
Today's news curated by upday.
Maine's top election official has ruled that Donald Trump cannot run for president next year in the state, citing a constitutional insurrection clause. Secretary of State Shenna Bellows said Trump was not eligible because of his actions leading up to the US Capitol riot in 2021. Maine now joins Colorado as the two states to ban Trump from the ballot.
Read more » BBC News
A man who tried to save three men trapped in a submerged 4×4 vehicle said they were "swept away" as they attempted to cross a river. Emergency services including police, ambulance and a helicopter attended a location on the River Esk near Glaisdale shortly before midday on Thursday. A 4×4 was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3pm and three men found inside had died, North Yorkshire Police said.
Read more » upday
A 15-year-old surfer killed by a shark off the coast of South Australia was a "standout" talent, his club has said. Khai Cowley died after being attacked by a suspected great white while surfing with his father on Thursday. Seaview Road Board Riders said he was the third-generation of his family to find a home at the club, following his grandfather and uncle, with all three winning awards at a recent surfing festival.
Read more » Sky News
Burglars have reportedly targeted Jack Grealish's property, stealing jewellery and watches worth £1 million while he played against Everton. Around 10 members of Grealish's family, including both his parents and his fiancée, were inside watching the match on TV when they heard noises upstairs and activated a panic alarm.
https://www.upday.com/uk/burglars-take-gbp1-million-in-jewellery-and-watches-from-jack-grealishs-cheshire-mansion?utm_source=upday&utm_medium=referral
You may also like
Read more from UK News
Extreme weather has seen records broken and many lives lost or displaced in 2023. Severe conditions brought turmoil across the world, impacting small towns and major cities, as storms, heatwaves, floods, and droughts claimed many lives and destroyed communities. Scientists believe preliminary figures show the past 12 months to be the hottest in 125,000 years.
https://news.sky.com/story/hottest-12-months-in-125-000-years-how-extreme-weather-broke-more-records-in-2023-13022932
